article.citation: Wheat JD: Penile paralysis in stallions given propiopromazine. J Am Vet Med Assoc. 1966 Feb 15;148(4):405-6.
Olling M, Stephany RW, Rauws AG: The determination of propiopromazine in animal tissue. J Vet Pharmacol Ther. 1981 Dec;4(4):291-4.
Haagsma N, Bathelt ER, Engelsma JW: Thin-layer chromatographic screening method for the tranquillizers azaperone, propiopromazine and carazolol in pig tissues. J Chromatogr. 1988 Jan 29;436(1):73-9.

Wronska D, Niezgoda J, Pierzchala K, Sechman A, Bobek S, Hamid AB: [Effect of phenothiazine derivative on adrenal cortex response of sheep to repeated emotional stress]. Endokrynol Pol. 1991;42(4):567-74.
Hofman WF, Riegle GD: Effects of electroanesthesia and a phenothiazine tranquilizer on thermoregulation in the sheep. Am J Vet Res. 1977 Mar;38(3):403-6.
Rauws AG: [Tranquilizers in the transport of slaughtering pigs: a problem of residues?]. Tijdschr Diergeneeskd. 1983 Sep 1;108(17):659-64.

Garcia-Martinez D, Portilla-de Buen E, Leal C, Santillan P, Muniz J: The immediate response to severe shock in a canine model with a combination of hypertonic-hyperoncotic solution with naloxone. Shock. 2006 Oct;26(4):379-85.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenothiazines. These are polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a phenothiazine moiety, which is a linear tricyclic system that consists of a two benzene rings joined by a para-thiazine ring.
